page.title: 10Continuation from Page 9.
page.content: Mrs Hinett remembers that it wasn't until 1934 that water was laid on. Before this water was drawn from a pump,which was situated between the house and the first classroom.On wash- days the children were not allowed to play in the garden due to the headmasters wife hanging out her washing there. The boys had to draw thewater for her from the pumps to fill her copper-boiler. Very rarely was there any games or P.E.because there wasn't a playing field and the classrooms were not big enough.At the start of the day all the children congregated at the end of Back Lane and were then escorted past the Bear's Head and on to school. In conclusion Mrs.Hinett has seen a lot of changes during her life time and she feels they are not all for the better.
